messages.content: What is the ComfyUI-Styles_CSV_Loader extension used for?
The ComfyUI-Styles_CSV_Loader extension is used to load styles from a CSV file, primarily for migration purposes from the automatic1111 Stable Diffusion web UI.
How can I install the ComfyUI-Styles_CSV_Loader extension?
You can install the extension by either cloning the repository into the `custom_nodes` folder of ComfyUI and restarting ComfyUI, or using the ComfyUI-Manager to install this extension.
Where should the `styles.csv` file be located for the ComfyUI-Styles_CSV_Loader extension to work?
The `styles.csv` file must be located in the root of `ComfyUI` where `main.py` resides.
What is the structure of the styles in the CSV file for the ComfyUI-Styles_CSV_Loader extension?
Each style is represented as a dictionary with the keys being `style_name` and the values being a list containing `positive_prompt` and `negative_prompt`, which are outputs of this Node.
Who is the author and how can I support them?
The author of the ComfyUI-Styles_CSV_Loader extension is David Fischer ([theUpsider](https://github.com/theUpsider)). You can support him on [BuyMeACoffee](https://www.buymeacoffee.com/theupsider).
